page.title: 08MANOR HOUSE HOSPITAL
page.content: The{Manor House Hospital}was founded in 1916 by the{Allies' Benevolent {Society}which was formed in 1914 to provide field hospitals for the French Army. In 1916 the team returned home to England where the government asked them to build a hospital for{casual- {ties of industry. The hospital got its name because it was built on the site of the{Golders {Green Manor.}The earliest parts of the buildings were huts and afterwards became wards, but now they are used as stores. The members paid one old penny a week, now they pay fifty pence a week. In the hospital they have a busy time with{100 in-patients and 500 out- {patients}to look after and sometimes some of them are difficult. In the hospital there is{no Maternity Care. {}
